snippet: The actions include freezing all property of the Central Bank of Iran, other Iranian financial institutions and the Iranian government in the United States.
abstract: White House moves to enforce tightened sanctions against Iran because of the country’s suspect nuclear program, freezing all property of the Central Bank of Iran, other Iranian financial institutions and the Iranian government in the United States; restrictions raise new warnings to financial institutions in other nations that they could face big penalties in the United States if they did business with Iran’s central bank.

byline.original: By JACKIE CALMES and RICK GLADSTONE
byline.contributor: Jackie Calmes reported from Washington, and Rick Gladstone from New York. Mark Landler contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The actions include freezing all property of the Central Bank of Iran, other Iranian financial institutions and the Iranian government in the United States.

headline.main: Obama Imposes Freeze on Iran Property in U.S.
headline.print_headline: Obama Imposes Freeze On Iran Property in U.S.
